title: DataStream Data Schema
description: Water Quality Data Schema based on WQX. Version: 2.6.4

MonitoringLocationID.title: Monitoring Location ID
MonitoringLocationID.description: Valid Monitoring ID; required for most Activity Type Codes; Must correspond to Monitoring Locations already in WQX/STORET or entered in Monitoring Locations tab

MonitoringLocationHorizontalAccuracyMeas.title: Activity Horizontal Accuracy Measure
MonitoringLocationHorizontalAccuracyMeas.description: The horizontal measure indicating the relative accuracy of the latitude and longitude coordinates

MonitoringLocationVerticalMeasure.title: Vertical Measure
MonitoringLocationVerticalMeasure.description: The measure of elevation (i.e., the altitude), above or below a reference datum.

ActivityType.title: Activity Type
enum: Quality Control Alternative Measurement Sensitivity Plus
Quality Control Field Replicate Portable Data Logger
Quality Control Field Sample Equipment Rinsate Blank

ActivityDepthHeightMeasure.title: Activity Depth/Height Measure
ActivityDepthHeightMeasure.description: The distance from the surface to the point in the water column at which the activity is conducted (depth or height measured from a reference point)

CharacteristicName.title: Characteristic
enum: Benzo[b]fluoranthene, mixt with benzo[j]fluoranthene and benzo[k]fluoranthene
Carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand, non-standard conditions
Grain size, coarse sand (>=630 to 2000 um)
Ice cover, floating or solid, as % area estimate
o-Xylene, mixt. with m-xylene and p-xylene
Precipitation 24hr prior to monitoring event amount
Silica gel treated n-hexane extractable material
Snow cover on ice as % area estimate
Sodium adsorption ratio [(Na)/(sq root of 1/2 Ca + Mg)]
Specific UV Absorbance at 254 nm, corrected for Fe

ResultValue.title: Result Value
ResultValue.description: Measured value of characteristic, required if Result Detection Condition Text is blank, No entry allowed if Result Detection Condition Text is populated.

ResultDetectionQuantitationLimitMeasure.title: Result Detection/Quantitation Limit Measure
ResultDetectionQuantitationLimitMeasure.description: The reportable measure of the result for the chemical, microbiological or other characteristic being analyzed.  Required if Result Detection Condition is `Not Detected`, `Present Above Quantification Limit`, or `Present Below Quantification Limit`.

ResultComment.title: Result Comment
ResultComment.description: Provided to allow for the entry of comments about result

LaboratoryName.title: Laboratory Name
LaboratoryName.description: Name of Laboratory performing the analysis

LaboratorySampleID.title: Laboratory Sample ID
LaboratorySampleID.description: Unique identifier for the lab sample

allOf.title: CharacteristicName-MethodSpeciation
allOf.description: Certain characteristics, particularly nutrient parameters, require a method speciation (e.g., 'as N', or 'as NO3' for nitrate). This information is related to how the parameter was analyzed. For more guidance regarding how to map nutrient parameters please visit DataStream's [Best Practices Guide for Nutrient Data](https://datastream.cdn.prismic.io/datastream%2F9d12bb3f-e456-4de0-9613-f8f7e50f221a_datastream+nutrient+data+best+practices+guide_march2019.pdf) located on the Resources page.

allOf.title: CharacteristicName-ResultSampleFraction
allOf.description: Certain characteristics require a sample fraction, for example metals (e.g. 'Dissolved' or 'Total') and nutrient parameters (e.g. 'Filtered' or 'Unfiltered'). This information is related to the level of filtration of the sample prior to analysis. For more guidance regarding how to map nutrient parameters please visit DataStream's [Best Practices Guide for Nutrient Data](https://datastream.cdn.prismic.io/datastream%2F9d12bb3f-e456-4de0-9613-f8f7e50f221a_datastream+nutrient+data+best+practices+guide_march2019.pdf) located on the Resources page.

enum: Quality Control Field Replicate Portable Data Logger

allOf.title: ResultDetectionCondition-ResultValue
allOf.description: You may only have ResultValue OR ResultDetectionCondition populated for a single observation.

allOf.title: ResultDetectionCondition-ResultDetectionQuantitationLimit-above-below
allOf.description: When the ResultDetectionCondition is set to 'Below Detection/Quantification Limit' or 'Above Detection/Quantification Limit' for a data point  'ResultDetectionQuantitationLimitMeasure' and  'ResultDetectionQuantitationLimitUnit' should be populated.

allOf.title: ResultDetectionCondition-ResultDetectionQuantitationLimit-not-detect
allOf.description: When ResultDetectionCondition is set to 'Not Detected' this means data was not detected, and 'Detected Not Quantified' means data was not quantified within the defined laboratory reporting limits or method detection limits. For these cases, ResultDetectionQuantitationLimit fields should be left blank.

allOf.title: ActivityType-ResultAnalyticalMethod
allOf.description: If a data point is from a grab sample analyzed in the lab (i.e., ActivityType is 'Sample-Routine') you must provide information on how the sample was analyzed. If you populate the ResultAnalyticalMethodID (e.g. '4500-P'), the ResultAnalyticalMethodContext must also be populated (e.g.  'APHA').  If you do not know the ResultAnalyticalMethodID and ResultAnalyticalMethodContext, you must at least fill in ResultAnalyticalMethodName (e.g. 'Ion Chromatography'). If the analytical methods are unknown, you can also enter 'Undefined' in ResultAnalyticalMethodName. LaboratoryName is also mandatory for all lab-analyzed samples. Once these corrections are made, this error message should be resolved.
